fmk49048: I know this doesn't work for everyone, but sometimes I can't fight it or beat it. sometimes I surrender to it knowing it will pass. Like a big wave. I can't stop it, I can't climb it. iedee19: WOW! You have no idea how incredibly timely and affirming this was for me. Ive been in a very low depressive episode for several months. __goldlion__: Thank you for sharing! As someone who lives with an anxiety disorder, this really resonates with me. And the fact that you are willing to share makes me feel less alone. So thank you. Sending you positive vibes and virtual hugs. ♥️🙏🏼
sideorderly: Sometimes there’s not a line or causal effect that is clear. Sometimes it’s stored somewhere in your nervous system, and something occurred that stimulated a old stored somatic response. All of this is subconscious, beyond just causal relationships. Stored trauma can peak at any time, and the slightest flicker of a feeling, can interrupt the most connected shaman. It’s about sitting in it. Learning where you’re feeling it in your body. Focusing on that internal experience. What does it bring up? Working through that somatic response and feeling can help expose your “why’s” and “how to’s”. Sending you deep grounding and healing vibes. The transparency and respect that you give to your process is soooo valuable to us all. Thank you.
lalamandee: Lizzo always pumps me up. Bling bling that’s the goddess in you 😘

darby_moran: I have never read anything that fully explains my own feelings of depression and all that it entails. It felt like I was reading something that I myself wrote. hotpieceoclass: WOOF, the accurateness of that metaphor. drowning under flowers. i hear you on this, and REALLY get how fucking confusing it is. this thing that i live with also is so impenetrable sometimes, no matter how hard i work to understand it. i have no answers but i’m sending you some light and i appreciate you and your sharing all the time, whether in “good” times or “bad.” 💛

erikay.erikay: I have seriously listened to every fucking song on Spotify today that makes me feel sad. I do this when I’m in a depressive state and I don’t know why. Maybe I just think I can force myself to cry the sad out of me. Never works. This time of year just kills me because I need the sun (I’m a Texan living in the UK) to heal and there isn’t much of it around. Sigh. I’ve honestly just ordered pizza and it’s on the way.
saucydeluxey: ❤️. It does help. You and all of us. Hoping the flowers clear for you soon so you can get above them instead of down below them.
ladybuckmaster: This. I also try to problem solve my depression - and that jerk is not rational.
atomicbuddha: When I feel this I find only one thing helps, & it may sound too simple, && it may not work for everyone, BUT, what EVENTUALLY HELPS me is to bring my attention fully, 100% present... Sometimes the only way to do that is to literally narrate what I am doing in each moment. (The voice in my head is usually monotone and listless but nevertheless I narrate) "I'm brushing my teeth. I'm getting in my car, I appreciate (even if you appreciate NOTHING, saying it sometimes, eventually, brings about small pockets of gratitude) I appreciate how firm my Subaru's seats are. I'm putting on my sunglasses. I'm driving to work. I appreciate that I have a great job to drive to. Oh look, it's raining. That cloud looks cool. Rain makes things green. That asshole driver just cut that lady off. I'm here at work. I'm parking..." And so it goes until I'm starting to feel ACTUAL gratitude again. Sometimes it takes minutes, sometimes days. I try to pair this with actual, deep belly breathing because I know that activates my parasympathetic nervous system and activating that does wonders for mind and body. It's not a panacea but it might help someone reading this comment, so I wanted to share. 💙
duftesarah: Thank you so much for sharing! Sending love from Germany 💕
drjuliaingle: Thank you so much for sharing. You perfectly describe what it’s like to be in a depressive episode. You are amazing and you will get through this. 💕💕💕
elinorwhite: Sending love until you can smell the flowers again!
lindasahlin: Thank you for sharing, Jen. It does help others, and I hope, you too. ♥️
buckleygal: I'm with you. I had TMS treatment in June and have been feeling great with no thoughts of feeling like a burden since. But it's creeping back in, though no ever near as badly as before. the.unraveling.fern: They way you articulated your experience with depression is beautiful. I feel you girl. I also dance with depression. Thank you for sharing this and putting it out there. I know that's not always easy, but it does feel good to get it off the chest. I'm glad that you have a good community here to support you. Don't worry, the smell of the flowers will soon come back into your nostrils, just be patient with yourself until then. Much love to you.
dabouch: You’re on day 10 and making it to work-that in itself is a huge accomplishment. You’re coherent, your brain is thinking at least somewhat clearly and you so beautifully say things so many of us feel but can’t express. And in times like these, we need to remind ourselves of the accomplishments, no matter how small. Good as Hell is on repeat for me when I’m in my fog! But when I’m really deep, Frightened Rabbit just gets it.
poltaroid: me and my sisters @handelspoon @mspolton are sending you so much love jg 💗💗💗
wotwtc: Remember that you’re a 100% that Gotch💗
sandsmama: A mountain of flowers. It’s that exactly. Thank you for sharing with us, Jen. I get it completely and I’m so often right there beside you. 🖤
the_mother_work: Same. In it with you. Trying to convince myself of the reasoning that how I’m feeling is end of year/decade energetic clearing out, but your brain doesn’t care about that when you feel this way. ❤
meghan.awalt: you have a gift for putting words to these feelings that , while uniquely yours , also resonate with me (and so many others) Being a florist , that mountain of flowers analogy is so very real to me . gonna remember it for my next 4.1 day. so much gratitude for your vulnerability and wishing you ease through this moment .
nataliemicheleharger: Damn. This is so important to share. Thank you thank you thank you
franca_02: watching “I love Lucy” helps me sometimes. And knowing that we are not alone in going through this. A bit like a club. Sending love and calm feelings. thanks for sharing. 🌞🌞🌞
claireottley: "Suffocating under a mountain of beautiful flowers" is such a perfect way to describe this feeling. I feel this, often, and am constantly working to quiet the shame that comes along as a result. Hearing you, understanding you, supporting you. ♥️
ajasax: Thank you for this. At a 3.5 today and just grateful for those extra .5 points. Thank you for sharing your experience so we don’t all feel so alone.
fleurwoodsart: So relate. Sending magic fuck iff depression potion.. when I find it. Til then 💖
lindsaypete: You put into words what I and most can’t, and that helps us all! Sending you love 💕✨
melissadowler: Oof. It’s hard, and it’s also ok to be down in it sometimes. ❤️
christinemfoote: 💗💗💗 it’s so hard when we intellectually know everything is going well but the body and mind make their own rogue decision, which deepens the guilt. thank you for always sharing 😘
thisfreebird: same (or at least similar). Last night ate a giant bag of salt & vinegar chips, opened a box pot of gold chocolates I found in the cupboard, slayed some pumpkin cheesecake all while asking myself why I was doing this to myself even tho I was aware of why/what was happening. New day today. Almost out of the hole. Keep saying it until it happens. 🥬🌈
rebeccabillybob: I love your honesty , I’m the save, hate when I can’t assign my anxieties or depression to something, it then a circle and heightens because if that xx. Sending you hugs x
gull.gram: Eating foods that taste good and make you happy are part of the getting out of the depression slump. heykimdang: This. Absolutely this is how it feels to have depression. Some days you just can’t explain why you feel so low. Thank you sharing.
eml898: Gosh. This is what my last 2 weeks have been like. Cycling between anxiety and depression. I keep forcing myself to watch Nailed It- holiday edition and if Nicole Beyer makes me laugh I think "I'm okay." But it's been a tough one. Maybe the earth shifted a little and fucked us up?
sarahlanemedia: Same rn 😞 hang in there, sometimes you just have to wait for it to pass
lolo_rad_o: This cuts deep 🔪🌪🖤 thank you for putting words to feelings! #thistooshallpass

christislomka: I get it this on many levels. Sending hugs.
radiantmeatball: Same, except peanut butter. Even the gross natural kind that I buy so I don’t binge eat it when feeling like crap but have available when making things that call for peanut butter.
pepperpheasant: Love you Jen, as always thank you for sharing your vulnerability. Wishing you relief soon and sending you BIG hang in there kitty poster vibes your way 😽❤️
mickmegan: Totally hits home! Thank you for sharing.
superchris77: feeling this and you SO hard . you describe it perfectly .. the guilt of not being able to enjoy a beautiful life .. its SO confusing and demoralizing . im with you and many others in this . thank you jen for sharing ❤️ always eloquent and real ❤️ you inspire me endlessly
justkatwithak: Mental illnesses are so incredibly tough & feeling that depression when it strikes is unbelievably difficult to put into words! Mostly because it’s not tangible! I know I find talking about it extremely cathartic & healing! By sharing your experience of it can only be a good thing & it truly hope it DOES help you! I’m pretty damn sure it helps others feel less alone & isolated too! 💖 Sending hugs from across the pond & hope you start to feel a bit brighter soon x
poopiej: It is brilliant that you can take a minute to tap in to what you can name, see what you can’t, and share it. I wish i had powerful words of wisdom but i have none. She’s a sneaky bitch and she does what she wants, that depression gal.
liberteeurope: Have you ever heard of #HumanDesign? I hope you do, it helped me so much! I don’t know your human design type (I would need your birth time) But this sounds like a Generator Plateau to me... https://www.puregenerators.com/blog/plateau
shellydoty: I am always so grateful for your honesty
le.doucette: You’ve helped a ton of people just by writing this. I’m struggling too and all the perfect holiday posts make me feel more miserable and then here you are saving my day with honesty. 💖💕❤️ I hope the fog lifts for you immediately😘
julann.j.h: You’ve just described how I feel. Stuck underneath. Down below is another version of myself with thoughts and feelings that aren’t reflected on the surface. Thanks for being vulnerable and reminding me I have company down here.

yefrisensei: Thank you so much! So wonderful! 😭❤️

theodorable: This, too, shall pass, even if it doesn’t feel like it right now ❤️❤️

amanduhleach: Thank you for sharing. Sending warm vibes your way. 💖
call.them.rogues: Thank you for this. Thank you for everything. I hear you, and I love the heart inside you.
lindsaydeeann: I so much appreciate your beautiful honesty. It is so hard to put into words the way I feel and this is it. mavisvancamp: This has been my whole year, but I never would have been able@to articulate it so well. That helps, reading your description—and the damn eating—now I’m also fat. Dammit. I am going to think about the dotted bs straight lines. Thank you. You are a gift.
bethy.hebb: Can I just say, same?! Thank you for making me feel like it’s ok to not be ok and that we are in this together😊
beccafrancesatkinson: Beautiful thank you ❤️ @lucyswank sharing this with u too
laura.gwinn: For me it really thing it was the season change coupled with time change. Just took me down. Sending you so much love and support ♥️
sun_qu33n: This hit me so hard. I relate to this so much. ❤️🌈 #staystrong #depressionsucks
linds277: Thank you for sharing so openly. You’re helping so many people feel less alone and ashamed. Something that helps me to remember, “this too shall pass” 💕 Sending love
torinichole18: @lizzobeeating really fucking battles that shit for me sometimes. I hope she knows she has that kind of fucking power
adrod26: OMG! I can relate to this so badly. Everything seems ok, somehow I’m still sad, anxious; can’t pinpoint. It doesn’t matter how much I talk with my Dr. we can’t sort it out. delphinevanh: Did you hear about Toxoplasma gondii, the bizarre parasite that makes mice unafraid of cats, a brief infection with a weakened form of the protozoan caused mice to permanently lose their innate fear of cats and to get trapped. Brain and guts are totally connected. A big army of bacteria in your guts must enjoy the pizzas but their development, death and colonization create toxins that pass the encephalic barrier. To stay away from carbs help me to keep a clear brain 🧠
guerreiroclaudia: I hear and feel all of this. Especially this holiday time of year
itshotinthistrailer: We are the same person. And honestly is there even a straight line to the catalyst ever or is that just our cognitive nature doing anything it can to point to or identify the WHY when we all know.... it is just there, boom surprise, just shows up like your fucking period does and there is no true straight line catalyst, and only the dotted line things that are "aiding and abetting" the how bad it will be/ how quick the recovery or upswing. Ugh, sucks. Hugs and pizza fortunately/unfortunately.
melaniesantos.co: Love this and you @jengotch. You always make me feel better about sharing my 3.5’s on here too. Sending you + energy so you can get tf out of this episode faster than normal. 🌹
aestheticsofjoy: ❤️All I know is it’s pretty f’ing brave and generous to put this out there and I am proud that I know you.❤️
nicole_andexler: Sending virtual hugs🤗 Thanks for being so raw & real. You will come out the other side strong as ever🌸🌼🌺
thehappyloveproject: Were not supposed to understand it. When we are low it only means we need to release and heal wounds. When we do that, we become high vibe again. Its time to enjoy. When we are low again, its time for healing.
meltedxheese: I'm sorry you're going through this. So am I. Your words capture what my brain does, trying to figure it out. Thank you. I wish we weren't here but thankful I'm not alone
paulahisel: I wish I didn’t, but I understand this all too well. Hoping and praying those flowers start smelling great for you soon
jamierondeau: The brain can be such an assh*le. You’ve got this. ✨✨
lynn__bird: Feeling this lately, trying to convince myself that its seasonal and that more light will help somehow
little_suz: Sending you a REALLY big hug 🤗
amber.rhodes: You took the words out of my mouth. Thank you for speaking on it.💖
helloknicole: Rollercoaster for one! 🙃 I know these feelings. You’re dope for helping to destigmatize them by sharing them. THANK YOU.
erindelaneyjoyce: Blast the Lizzo. Be kind to yourself. YOU’RE THE BOSS. 💕
hppuffnstuff: @jengotch I feel almost EXACTLY the same way. It isn't easy and asking for help can be harder than the actual depression. Posts like this that destigmatize mental health, along with the support of my partner, and my own desire to improve my mental health landed me in a psychiatrists office. I felt hella guilty and ashamed because I couldn't beat this on my own. But I know this is so common. My doc shared that asking for help is a sign of unbelievable strength. Most people just suffer through their depression instead of getting the help that's available. Anywho... I just want to say thanks. It's posts like this that remind me why I do what I do and encourage me to keep aiming for improvement. I hope you find a way through your own struggle. It's super hard and you're a strong woman for owning your shit like this.
denzmarsh: Hearing and recognising your words. You are not alone. And all this will pass. Your dancing insta stories help me on a regular basis. X
rademacher: Some times these seasons creep back on us when things are fine Becca use part of us doesn’t think we deserve to be happy. For me it can come right after great things. My self talk is terrible and I haven’t gotten past over around that deep feeling that happiness isn’t for me or that true peace in my body isn’t for me. In my life this feeling of unworthy of sustaining joy tends to be an underlying cause of my depression.
wrenarthur: Thank you. You are so articulate. ♥️
amanda_l_wolf: I’ve never read a more accurate depiction of a depressive episode. I hate to hear of anyone experiencing these feelings, even a total stranger. Prayers you’re out of the valley soon.
sherise.lee: 💗🌺 you can power thru this! I’m barely powering thru it today. For me: Coffee painting dog kids... ok and pizza!
oftenwander: This time of year is ALWAYS a trigger for me, always. Sending you big 20 second hug and sunshine in your eyes. Better days ahead, this we know for sure! ❤️❤️❤️
amdable: God this is so me right now.
marisarugnetta: These are words I could have written myself. There is beauty all around but somehow it’s missed when I’m not right. I’m sending you love and positive vibes for a quick turn around. I like to tell people that sharing brings peace to my pain. I am often the voice of the person I wish I heard years ago so that I didn’t feel so alone on my journey. It’s amazing what sharing can do for not only the reader, but for the person being vulnerable. I have found that the harder the times and situation, the more vulnerable I tend to be. Being vulnerable has allowed me to find strength. I hope the same for you. Please keep sharing, you touch so many lives by doing so... and many will never mention a word. Never like a post. Never comment or share. Lives are impacted and people are inspired. Please continue to share, especially when it feels the hardest... you are making a difference in lives! Thank you for being you and sharing you with us. I know I appreciate your words and am inspired by you often! 💗
hollycnu: Humans lie. Objects lay. That’s how I remember it! Big love to you 💓
meredithgeller1: Sending you ♥️♥️♥️...and more ♥️. And grace in these moments. Powerful share. Thank you.✨
farmgirlfashionista: So sorry you’re struggling. Thank you for your honesty though. The guilt is the worst. ❤️🙏🏻🤗
moss_and_lava: Thanks for sharing. I’m confident you’ll be around the bend soon and beautiful fragrant petals will be raining down on you leaving space to see the sun again. mckenziejoroberts: That analogy. You’ve got such a gift ❤️
alison_maeby: For what it’s worth, your words completely describes my current situation. And honestly? So many others I know. harmonycircusvintage: You beautifully and accurately described exactly what I experience consistently. However, I’ve allowed depression to take over for far too long. mkminnis_: That exact feeling is how I finally pinpointed that I had depression. For years there was a *reason*: long hours at work, miserable winter weather, shitty dungeon apartment.
